parallel
Class SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator

java.lang.Object
  parallel.SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator
public class SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator
extends java.lang.Object

The SimplePriorityMsgPassingCoordinator class: yet another class that allows sending and receiving (synchronous and asynchronous) data between threads. It behaves as the SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinator, except that tasks are assumed to have different priorities, and higher-priority tasks are received before lower-priority ones. The class is used e.g. with the FasterParallelAsynchBatchPriorityTaskExecutor.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2014

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

setMaxSize

public static void setMaxSize(int num)
                       throws ParallelException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
sets the size of the queue of messages. Must be called only prior to any other call to the getInstance() methods.

Parameters:
num - int the new maximum size of the queue.
Throws:
ParallelException - if a call to the getInstance() methods occurred before this call.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0.

sendData

public void sendData(ComparableTaskObject data)
              throws ParallelException
stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is. The method returns immediately.

Parameters:
data - ComparableTaskObject
Throws:
ParallelException - if there are more data than _maxSize in the queue

sendDataBlocking

public void sendDataBlocking(ComparableTaskObject data)
stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is. The method will wait if the queue is full until another thread consumes a datum and allows this thread to write to the _data buffer.

Parameters:
data - Object

recvData

public java.lang.Object recvData()
retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call (from another thread) to sendData[Blocking](data). If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until another thread stores an appropriate datum. The implementation will always receive the first datum available in the priority queue.

Notice: this method should not be used in cases where ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject object is sent, since the invocation of this method by a thread, may well result in the object being received without any concern about the calling thread's id.

Returns:
Object

recvData

public java.lang.Object recvData(int myid)
retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call (from another thread) to sendData[Blocking](data) that either happens to be a simple ComparableTaskObject or a ThreadSpecificComparableTaskObject with a thread-id that matches the argument passed in. If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until another thread stores an appropriate datum.

Returns:
Object

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
synchronized method captures a snapshot of the _data queue for debugging purposes only.

Returns:
String
